title: Potential inhibition of COVID-19-driven pneumonia by immunosuppressive therapy and anti-TNFalpha antibodies: a case report.
text: Potential inhibition of COVID-19-driven pneumonia by immunosuppressive therapy and anti-TNFalpha antibodies: a case report.

similar.title: The potential role of TNFalpha in 2019 novel coronavirus pneumonia.
text: The potential role of TNFalpha in 2019 novel coronavirus pneumonia.

The outbreak of 2019 novel coronavirus has spread rapidly in multiple countries. We report the first case of 2019-nCoV infection in a patient with Ankylosing Spondylitisthe (AS), who was a biological agent (anti-TNFalpha) user in Wenzhou, China, and describe the clinical course and management of the case.
abstract: The outbreak of 2019 novel coronavirus has spread rapidly in multiple countries. We report the first case of 2019-nCoV infection in a patient with Ankylosing Spondylitisthe (AS), who was a biological agent (anti-TNFalpha) user in Wenzhou, China, and describe the clinical course and management of the case.
